intro: Pimpinella pratensis, commonly known as field parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and is often used in herbal medicine for its mild aromatic properties. Its botanical structure supports its role in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
